headline.main: ELECTION TO BE HELD; Cardinals Are to Convene in About Two Weeks to Choose Successor Cardinal Assumes Role Bells Ring Death Knell Pope Paul VI Dies at Age 80 at His Summer Residence Attack Occurred During Ceremony Nine Days of Mourning Had Several Ailments 'Old Age is the Illness'

snippet: ROME, Aug. 6--Pope Paul VI, the 262d occupant of the Throne of St. Peter, died peacefully tonight at the age of 80 after a heart attack in his summer residence at Castel Gandolfo.

byline.original: By HENRY TANNER Special to The New York Times
